Posts.Content: Aug 3, 2009 09:39AM Ruth1 wrote: Shauna, I have been stage 4 breast cancer victum for 4 years, and my doctor uses the tumor marker test CEA all the time with me as it has really been accurate for my tumors which have been in my bones and the latest in my liver.  I never was as high as your mother, but I am now down to 17. And that is because he has put me on tamoxifin which so far is working great and much easier than the chemo Abraxene caused many problems for me, neurophy in my legs and feet and therefore my walking ability  isn't too great.  My doctor told me that the CEA tumor marker tesst for non-smokers normal is 3 and for smokers it is 5. Ruth1
Posts.Title: CEA Tumor Markers shopper16 LuAnnH

Posts.Content: Ruth1 wrote: 17 years ago I was first diagnosed with breast cancer had my left breast removed, and put on Tamosifin..  Did well.  Six years ago the cancer came back started on my breast bone.  Diagnosed as Stage 4 metasized breast cancer.  Since then it has jumped from my breast bone to eventually all my bones then skips from there  to the liver, lungs, femor arms .It never seems to stay long.  I get all kinds of tests, sometimes the machines CT, Pet Scan, MRI ex-ray don't see them, other times there they are.  For six years I have been on chemo witih very few breaks.  Now I am experiencing along witih other things ANGER especially my family, not so much my friends. I don't know what to do ass they certainly do not deserve being treated this way.  As they have been a wonderful support for me during this time.  I cannot seem to show a lot of happiness when I am with them.  I snap at them, I wear hearing aides in both ears and still seem to have trouble hearing what they are saying as a result I aquise them of saying something which they deny saying.  I hope someone has some suggestions on what and how to make a change..  Thank you, Ruth1 Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Anger Ruth1 MJLToday

Posts.Content: Ruth1 wrote: Helloevery one. I'm not sure this is the correct place, but just to let everone know Ruth died of stage 4 breast cancer on Dec 12 2011, She fought the good battle for 17 years with a 11 years break and then it came back and she went through hell for 6 years. I'm pleased to say she died at home with her family all around her. Derrek Flick husband of 48 years, god I miss her. Derrek flick and family r_dflick@hotmail.com Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Ruth1 wrote: Stage 4 bc, three years ago diagnosed mets to sternum, ribs etc.  Had radiation to sternum.  This past January had severe pain right side lower back.  After doctors having car accidents etc almost a month of severe pain finally got in to see a urologist.  Had a stent put into the ureter tube because tests showed a blockage in tube leading from kidney to bladder.  Turns out it was scar tissue almost 2 inches long.  According to the urologist he has had 5 other bc patients that had had radiation with the same problem.   Now the stent is in, but now the pain has shifted from to back to the front of the lower belly, the stent is causing severe pain and bleeding.  But in order to stretch the ureter it must stay in.   Has anyone out there experienced anything like this??? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Side effect from Radiation?? Ruth1 snowyday

Posts.Content: Ruth1 wrote: Hi, I have been a stage 4 breast cancer victim for 5 years, have been on several different chemos, either they didn't work, or they stopped working.  My doctor put me on Taxol/avastin about 2 weeks ago had a reaction from Taxol, couldn't breathe, turned blue, horrible pain on spine from base of neck to bottom of spine, felt like someone was trying rip out my spine.  They put me on oxygen, and medicines.  I was fine then, a few days later tried again, with a lower dosage, same thing happened.  This Friday May 6, the doctor wanted to start me with Ixempro.  Started with low dosage of Ixempro it happened again.  So will not be going on that chemo.  I see my doctor next Wednesday the 12th.  Will see what we will be doing next.  My question is has anyone ever had this happen to them? Ruth1 Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Reactions to chemos Ruth1 mthomp2020

Posts.Content: May 9, 2010 12:19PM Ruth1 wrote: Yes, I have had Abraxane  as a result I have neurophy in my legs and feet, trouble walking etc.  My body evidently doesn't like chemo.  I have been on Femara which lasted 2 years, then on to Gemzar, Abraxaine. Aromason which didn't do anything, Tamoxifin which didn't do anything.  Have been on Zometa for 5 years.  It seems that the chemo which works on my tumors my body doesn't like.  And the ones my body likes doesn't do anything.  Also have been on Xeloda, Navelbiene, and of course Taxol.  This Wednesday I see the doctor, and will find out what we will be doing.  My tumor markers are going up and up.  which is not so good.  After five years of feeling crappy and tired. I wish we could find something. Ruth1
Posts.Title: Reactions to chemos Ruth1 mthomp2020

Posts.Content: Feb 10, 2010 06:01PM Ruth1 wrote: Thanks to breastcancer.org I have been able to learn just what the chemo that I am on will be doing to me, also some remedies to help with side effects.  Doesn't make them go away but helps to live with them.  Also, I do not feel so alone in this fight that I am going through for the past 5 years as a stage 4 bc patient.  NOT survivor!
Posts.Title: Please share how breastcancer.org has impacted you.... Moderators BouncingBetties

Posts.Content: Mar 17, 2009 10:15AM Ruth1 wrote: I had abraxine about one year ago.  It affected my legs very painful, and also numbness.  I too use a cane and for serious walking like the mall etc, a wheelchair.  It is somewhat better after acupuncture, just shooting electric like pain  and the numbness which is still there and becomes more intense the more walking done.  I really hate that chemo for what it has done to me, because of the horrible side effects I wasn't on it too long.  Sometimes wonder if it is worthwhile considering the side effects. Ruth1
